2020-02-12.text: You have masculine trans women and feminine trans men. That's because gender isn't limited to just socialization or expression, though these also play a role. Gender identity is based on both biological and environmental factors.

2020-02-11.text: Trans people are more likely to have intersex characteristics (chromosomal adnormalities, gray/white matter resembling the sex they identify as, larger clitorises on trans men). But twin studies also show environmental conditions (natal conditions/socialization) also play a role.

It's not purely a social construct. Studies suggest that there are environmental and biological factors that influence gender identity. But the gender norms we ascribe to people is social. And note that both of these only support Trans people.

You know we still get to criticize private citizens for smears right? Especially ones with large political influence.
If she stated that Bernie was losing the popular vote, that wouldn't have been a smear. Suggesting that no one likes Bernie was definitely a smear, however.
You know what white feminism is right? It simply refers to feminism that is not intersectional. The fact that Hillary's white wasn't even referenced.
Hillary provoked them, and they fought back. Perhaps they shouldn't have fought back, but it's a false equivalency to assume they're equally wrong.

Reactive Abuse Tactics in Politics

Step 1: Provoke progressive candidates with endless smears.

Step 2: Wait for them (or their supporters) to fight back.

Step 3: Accuse progressives of overreacting/being divisive/ harassment/etc

Step 4: Repeat

Unfortunately, news outlets are blatantly ignoring when progressives are attacked, and putting the entire focus on the reaction to said attack (even if it's not from the candidate themselves but their supporters). There's only so much provocation people can take.

There's no false equivalency between the two, though, and that's an important distinction. One of them is abuse and the other is reactive abuse: reactivate because you've been manipulated into fighting back and then are smeared for it.
You're sorely mistaken if you think that the issue was how much he touched people rather than whether the people he touched wanted to be touched. Consentual hugs are fine. 🙄

I understand that Sanders supporters have been repeatedly attacked. Unfortunately, when we fight back, the blame is then shifted back onto our reaction to said attack. That's not to say we should lie there and take it, but we have to be smart about our resistance.

It does actually matter. Reactive abuse is one way people shift blame onto the victim. When you're harassed repeatedly, decide to fight back, and then condemned for it, reactive abuse presents a false equivalency where there is none.

I am also a quarter Italian as well, so I'm half Latin.

I'm a quarter Nuevomexicana, three quarters white. My Nuevomexicano ancestry is mostly non-white, with indigenous, Arab, and black ancestry as well. My culture and the Spanish we speak is different than many other Chicanos, but we are also Chicano.

That's a valid point. I was dependent, but not addicted, to Adderall as a treatment for my ADHD. Dependent because it helped me function, but not addicted because I didn't have cravings or withdrawal once I ran out. I just wanted to function optimally again.

I like weed, but I also agree with you 100%. It's not a miracle drug, and honestly, I wish it was legal so that we, as a society, could have more open and honest conversations about the benefits and drawbacks.

We don't compel men into parenthood. Paying child support payments isn't parenthood. The reality remains, however,  that in order to opt out of parenthood, there's a cost. This is true for everyone, as mentioned previously. How do we make something inherently unequal equal?
Unfortunately, this situation is inherently unequal regardless of how you spin in.

The thing is, abortion isn't as simple as opting out of pregnancy. Nor is adoption. Although abortion is safer than pregnancy, it still takes a physical toll and sometimes even an emotional one. And giving up a child for adoption is often emotionally traumatic.

Once we are able to safely transplant a fetus from the womb into something else with less risk to the pregnant person than compared to an abortion, then you'll have a point. Until then, pregnancy adversely affects people with wombs. That's the reality.
I think we're on the same side. I don't agree with Warren's proposal.
